title: How to Extract the Audio From an MPEG Video File With Audacity

steps.headline: Search your computer for the file lame_enc.dll on your computer.
steps.description: Audacity will ask you for this file. You'll have to remember the folder it's in or make a copy of the file in a new folder. If you don't have it, then this website has a free download.

steps.headline: Check that the FFmpeg library is installed by going to Edit > Preferences.
Clicking on the library tab.
steps.description: Click the download button next to the FFmpeg library.

steps.headline: Go to "File type" drop-down arrow bar and choose FFmpeg-compatible files and click your desired video to be extracted and click Open.
You will see your MPEG video file has been loaded.
steps.description: You shouldn't be presented with the video, but with the audio from the video.

steps.headline: Click on File > Export as Mp3.
steps.description: If Audacity asks for the lame_enc.dll file, then go to the folder the .dll file's in and and click it. If it does not, then you have nothing to worry about

steps.headline: Move your mouse to "Save as type" and click the drop-down arrow bar to choose mp3 files.
steps.description: Name your file if you want to and click Save.

steps.headline: You should now have an Mp3 audio file of the video.

text: Download Audacity  Search your computer for the file lame_enc.dll on your computer. Audacity will ask you for this file. You'll have to remember the folder it's in or make a copy of the file in a new folder. If you don't have it, then this website has a free download. Open Audacity.  Check that the FFmpeg library is installed by going to Edit > Preferences.  Clicking on the library tab. Click the download button next to the FFmpeg library. Click on File > Open.  Go to "File type" drop-down arrow bar and choose FFmpeg-compatible files and click your desired video to be extracted and click Open.  You will see your MPEG video file has been loaded. You shouldn't be presented with the video, but with the audio from the video. Click on File > Export as Mp3. If Audacity asks for the lame_enc.dll file, then go to the folder the .dll file's in and and click it. If it does not, then you have nothing to worry about Move your mouse to "Save as type" and click the drop-down arrow bar to choose mp3 files. Name your file if you want to and click Save. You should now have an Mp3 audio file of the video.
sentences: Download Audacity  Search your computer for the file lame_enc.dll on your computer.
Audacity will ask you for this file.
You'll have to remember the folder it's in or make a copy of the file in a new folder.
If you don't have it, then this website has a free download.
Check that the FFmpeg library is installed by going to Edit > Preferences.
Click the download button next to the FFmpeg library.
Go to "File type" drop-down arrow bar and choose FFmpeg-compatible files and click your desired video to be extracted and click Open.
You will see your MPEG video file has been loaded.
You shouldn't be presented with the video, but with the audio from the video.
Click on File > Export as Mp3.
If Audacity asks for the lame_enc.dll file, then go to the folder the .dll file's in and and click it.
If it does not, then you have nothing to worry about Move your mouse to "Save as type" and click the drop-down arrow bar to choose mp3 files.
Name your file if you want to and click Save.
You should now have an Mp3 audio file of the video.
